name: Contemporary Italian Cinema Part II
description: (Offered in English) This course is a study of Italian cinema from the late 1970s to the present. Various works from several directors (Gabriele Salvatores, Gianni Amelio, Francesco Rosa, Roberto Benigni, and others) will be analyzed. Films and analyses will centre on themes, genres, etc. such as The Crisis of Cinema, Italians in the Holocaust, The Second World War, and The Cinema of Crisis: Commedia all'italiana Revisited through Identity and Immigration. [24L, 24T]
prerequisites: Prerequisite only applicable to students enrolled in an Italian Minor, Major or Specialist program, ITA100Y5.
